label: 太政大臣
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Daijō daijin (J.) 太政大臣, pronounced dajō daijin in the modern era. This position of prime minister governed the great council of state (daijōkan) in the Ritsuryō state system, though it was frequently left vacant due to the lack of qualified individuals.
